dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, Brexit finally happened on October 31st. Took 'em long enough.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, Brexit finally happened on October thirty first. Took 'em long enough.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: EU leaders have agreed to grant the U.K. a three-month delay to Brexit, meaning the October 31 exit deadline has been extended until January 31, 2020, at the latest.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, no, not quite. Like, it got delayed. Again.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, no, not quite. Like, it got delayed. Again.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: EU leaders have agreed to grant the U.K. a three-month delay to Brexit, meaning the October 31 exit deadline has been extended until January 31, 2020, at the latest.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, joy. Another three months? What even is that?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, joy. Another three months? What even is that?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: EU leaders have agreed to grant the U.K. a three-month delay to Brexit, meaning the October 31 exit deadline has been extended until January 31, 2020, at the latest.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, yeah, until January 31st. But, uh, Tusk, you know, the EU Council president? He tweeted about a "flextension" and some secret pact.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, yeah, until January thirty first. But, uh, Tusk, you know, the E U Council president? He tweeted about a flextension and some secret pact.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: EU Council president Donald Tusk tweeted the confirmation on Monday. He said: The EU27 has agreed that it will accept the U.K.s request for a Brexit flextension until 31 January 2020. The flextension means that the U.K. would be allowed to leave the EU before January 31, if the British and European Parliaments ratifiy a deal before then.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: A "flextension." Sounds like something they invented to make us care. What's the secret pact, like, more tea and biscuits?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A flextension. Sounds like something they invented to make us care. What's the secret pact, like, more tea and biscuits?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, no, it's, like, a real whisper, from inside the EU council. They're talking about a backroom deal.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, no, it's, like, a real whisper, from inside the E U council. They're talking about a backroom deal.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: A backroom deal? What, um, what would that even involve?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A backroom deal? What, um, what would that even involve?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's, uh, for a swift departure, if the British public votes for an EU-favorable deal in a referendum.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's, uh, for a swift departure, if the British public votes for an E U-favorable deal in a referendum.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The flextension means that the U.K. would be allowed to leave the EU before January 31, if the British and European Parliaments ratifiy a deal before then.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: A referendum? Oh, come on. We just did one of those. What's the point?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A referendum? Oh, come on. We just did one of those. What's the point?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Because Johnson, he's pushing for a general election in December now. He wants to, like, capitalize on public approval for a "renegotiated" outcome.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Because Johnson, he's pushing for a general election in December now. He wants to, like, capitalize on public approval for a renegotiated outcome.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The move now means Johnson will push for a general election this December, with British lawmakers set to debate the move this afternoon.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: But his "do or die" promise, that's totally gone. And he was legally forced to ask for this extension.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But his do or die promise, that's totally gone. And he was legally forced to ask for this extension.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Johnson has repeatedly said that he wanted the U.K. to leave the EU on October 31 do or die, but that certainly will not happen now. Johnson was forced by law to ask the EU for an extension earlier this month, after he failed to get his Brexit deal approved by U.K. parliamentarians.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but they always find a way to spin it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, but they always find a way to spin it.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, but, um, he's allegedly got a "foolproof plan" for a quick Brexit after the election. With, like, a rarely used emergency protocol.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, but, um, he's allegedly got a foolproof plan for a quick Brexit after the election. With, like, a rarely used emergency protocol.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: An emergency protocol. Of course. Just, like, a new buzzword for more deadlock.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: An emergency protocol. Of course. Just, like, a new buzzword for more deadlock.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: But he's connecting it to the debate. Heâ€™ll allow it if they agree to the December 12th election. It's, it's a play.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But he's connecting it to the debate. He'll allow it if they agree to the December twelfth election. It's, it's a play.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But for the bill to progress further, Johnson said on Friday that he would allow lawmakers to debate it if they agreed to allowing an election on December 12.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It's just a play to keep Brexit in the news forever.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's just a play to keep Brexit in the news forever.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: But this election, though, this could be, uh, a major turning point. It's not just another delay. It's, like, the next chapter.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But this election, though, this could be, uh, a major turning point. It's not just another delay. It's, like, the next chapter.
